title: No image on 820-4924
message: This 820-4924 was dropped. Now it shows nothing on the internal screen. On a external monitor it works normally and also recognizes the internal screen. If i look closely i can see that the LCD backlight is activating in the moment as the keyboard backlight turns on (same second the apple logo finishes loading on the external monitor) I can also close it and open it back up and the backlight tuens right back on. I can also turn LCD backlight brightnes up and down manually in the OS. I tried 2 other LCDs (not new ones - i took them a while ago from dead devices but at least one of them should show any reaction i think) and i get the same issue on both. I measured 5.11V on L8300. Now i am stuck.

title: No image on 820-4924
message: So you have backlight and just a black image? Check diode mode on C8320-29 on pin 1.

title: No image on 820-4924
message: That is fine. Is there continuity from pin 2 of all those caps to the end of a separate LCD cable?

title: No image on 820-4924
message: Yes it is. It beeps and the reading is always <10 Ohms

title: No image on 820-4924
message: Then there should just be an image. There could be board damage under the CPU still of course. Was the original LCD cracked or just no image after the drop?

title: No image on 820-4924
message: No it was not cracked. It was just no image...

title: No image on 820-4924
message: My bet is on cracked traces under the CPU then. Just to make sure SMC_LID is high? If so then this board is probably not fixable.
